body:
right now tests are failing with:

```
+ ruby src/ruby/end2end/package_with_underscore_checker.rb
src/ruby/end2end/package_with_underscore_checker.rb:34:in `spawn': No such file or directory - ./../../../../bins/dbg/protobuf/protoc (Errno::ENOENT)
	from src/ruby/end2end/package_with_underscore_checker.rb:34:in `block in main'
	from /usr/local/rvm/rubies/ruby-2.1.10/lib/ruby/2.1.0/tmpdir.rb:88:in `mktmpdir'
	from src/ruby/end2end/package_with_underscore_checker.rb:31:in `main'
	from src/ruby/end2end/package_with_underscore_checker.rb:54:in `<main>'
+ EXIT_CODE=1
+ exit 1
```

can you please fix this? thanks

I'm still seeing failures:

```
+ ruby src/ruby/end2end/package_with_underscore_checker.rb
src/ruby/end2end/package_with_underscore_checker.rb:34:in `spawn': No such file or directory - ./../../bins/opt/protobuf/protoc (Errno::ENOENT)
	from src/ruby/end2end/package_with_underscore_checker.rb:34:in `block in main'
	from /usr/local/rvm/rubies/ruby-2.1.10/lib/ruby/2.1.0/tmpdir.rb:88:in `mktmpdir'
	from src/ruby/end2end/package_with_underscore_checker.rb:31:in `main'
	from src/ruby/end2end/package_with_underscore_checker.rb:54:in `<main>'
+ EXIT_CODE=1
+ exit 1

```

@ganmacs I suggest, if possible, to run the test locally? (you can do so by running `tools/run_tests/run_tests.py -l ruby` from the root of the github repo. you can add `-r end2end` to that command to filter out the `rake` based tests).

I didn't notice that my local directory path(`$PROJECT_ROOT/src/ruby/end2end/`) and a CI directory path(`$PROJECT_ROOT/$CI_DIRECTORY/src/ruby/end2end/`) are different.
Actually in my local environment, all tests succeeded like below.

```
✔   ~/src/github.com/grpc/grpc [move-script-which-has-pre-req] 
$ git log --oneline |head -n1
c2e5fbee44 Follow rubocop
✔   ~/src/github.com/grpc/grpc [move-script-which-has-pre-req]
$ tools/run_tests/run_tests.py -l ruby -r end2end
PASSED: tools/run_tests/helper_scripts/build_ruby.sh [time=252.6sec, retries=0:0]2018-05-19 11:48:37,878 detected port server running version 20
2018-05-19 11:48:38,155 my port server is version 20
SUCCESS: All tests passed
tools/run_tests/run_tests.py -l ruby  712.61s user 135.71s system 204% cpu 6:55.44 total
```

This [commit](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/15377/commits/a349331715388fb24578cb1cd9bab2ffcc66d7c7) would fixed a failed test by changing relative path  to absolute path about protoc.
running tests again, sorry for delay

last round of tests failed with

```
RuboCop failed!
Running RuboCop...
Inspecting 63 files
..........................................................C....
Offenses:
src/ruby/end2end/package_with_underscore_checker.rb:39:43: C: Avoid comma after the last parameter of a method call.
      "--plugin=protoc-gen-grpc=#{plugin}",
                                          ^
63 files inspected, 1 offense detected
```

can you pease fix, thanks

This test seems to be failed... (
src/ruby/end2end/package_with_underscore_checker.rb:34:in `spawn': No such file or directory - src/ruby/end2end/../../../bins/dbg/protobuf/protoc (Errno::ENOENT)

In my enviroment `protoc` exists in `src/ruby/opt/protbuf/protoc`. but  CI doesn't like this. 
Would you tell me where the path of protoc binary is in CI?
@ganmacs able to resolve this last issue? This PR would be good to have :)

> Can you please move the make grpc_ruby_plugin into that "build" script... things should work then, thanks

Sorry for the late reply. I moved it into build_ruby.sh https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/15377/commits/b85357bc2e44c8d0d8912c28175b4dd8c5f40bc4
@ganmacs this looks great, thanks. Before merging, can you pease squash down your commits int one (with e.g. a `git rebase -i`) ? After that, this is mergeable.
